result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark F Froehlig was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (4th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

miscConds.notes:
BAIL OF $710.00 APPLIED. Balance to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

BAIL APPLIED TO DNA AND BLOOD COSTS. PAID IN FULL.
Blood costs to be forwarded to Village of Hartland Police Dept.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol and drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
Provide DNA Sample if not previously done.
Compliance with OWI Treatment Court contract and all conditions.
Not to operate MV without a valid driver's license.
Defendant to take Thinking for a Change Course.

timeConds.notes:
Condition Time - First 60 days Huber, remaining 195 days STAYED and to be used at Agent's discretion as well as to Huber/or Straight time.
Concurrent with: 21CT489

03:37 PM Defendant Mark F Froehlig in court.  Jack A. Pitzo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant's first appearance in OWI Treatment Court.  Court explains rules and outlines expectations of the defendant while in the program.  Defendant is ordered to comply with the rules, expectations and instructions/orders or they will be subject to sanctions including placement on the weekly sanction list or immediate incarceration.

It is hereby ordered, that on Wednesday, 06/08/2022 at 8:30 a.m. the above named defendant, as an OWI Treatment Court participant, be released to Wisconsin Community Services for placement on the CAM monitoring system until further order of the Court.

to the Court, filed by Attorney Kershek requesting an expedited plea and sentencing date.

**Reviewed by Judge Dorow on 04/05/22--Set for Plea/Sentencing ASAP.**
Hearing on April 22, 2022 at 09:30 am.

COURT MODIFIES CASH BOND DOWN TO $2,000 WITH THE SAME CONDITIONS. 

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle at all.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to enter any premises, other than a grocery store, that sells/serves alcohol beverages by the drink or into any liquor store.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 3 supervision.   CAM duration frequency pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols.  Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM.  Defendant to report to WCS the first business day after their release from custody.
